name: Starting from Zero
description: If you have zero tech experience and want to get into Cloud Engineering, this phase is for you. Take your time with these foundational concepts—understanding them well will make everything else easier.
short_description: Build your IT foundation: Linux basics, networking fundamentals, programming concepts, and cloud computing overview. Perfect for complete beginners.
objectives: Understand the basics of IT and cloud computing
Know what Linux, networking, programming, and DevOps are at a high level
Decide if you are committed to pursuing a career in cloud engineering
Be prepared for continuous learning in this ever-evolving field
tip: Already have tech experience? If you are already in tech and switching to cloud, you can skip to Phase 1: Linux and Bash.

certifications.title: CompTIA A+
certifications.description: An industry standard for people getting into tech
certifications.recommendation: Look up roles in your area—if they ask for it, consider getting it

entry_level_jobs.description: Starting in a support role is a great way to enter the tech industry. These positions are often entry-level friendly and may offer educational material and certification reimbursement.
